Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother!”
Reviews.Author: jpdozzi
Reviews.Content: First of all it is located on the beach, the pool is very nice and the area is good. However, once you get past the door be prepared for a huge disappointment. The rooms are completely outdated. The bathrooms are depressingly dark. Our first room we found a roach and asked to be moved. Our second room the refrigerator died and there was water all over the floor. The rugs are groady, the furniture saw better days, the air conditioners are so old they run all night - very loudly.....the only nice thing was the partial view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ClauMiami
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and really good front desk service but the elevators are sooo slow and the parking sooo packed we had to parked a block away. This hotel is located right on the beach (the beach is so beautiful) has a good size pool which is open until late (at your own risk) also has the Atlantic Jack's restaurant (really good food but the service is really slow). My husband and I stayed at a King Suite with ocean view, the bathroom was little but the bed was clean and comfortable. If you are interested in chair longs on the beach you have to rent them (about $20-30 a day) since the hotel only has them around the pool. This property is located near almost everything walking distance from the beach the pier, the shopping/dining plaza and the water park, also has few local shops around about 6 miles from the mall and the Nascar track. keep in mind this is an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..not bad!”
Reviews.Author: deps
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty good for the money. It is in a great location..walking distance of all the local things to do..ie..the Pier..Main Street where all the well known bars are...good restaurants. Our room was big...bathroom had separate vanity area from the actual toilet and shower...personnel were very nice,,two things that were not so great...pillows were hard as rocks. My husband did'nt think so but I did, and the " beach towels " that you check out for are more like kitchen dish towels...so bring your pillows and beach towels if possible..we did not eat at the hotel restaurant so cannot comment on that. There also was a $9.95 a day resort fee that we obviously did not notice when booking the room. All in all...great location...clean room, friendly people, nice pool, and close to all the things we thought were fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lisa422
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing rennovations and more are planned. It is an historic hotel with a beautiful lobby and large pool. I had a great Groupon deal that couldn't be beat for a room on the beach. The balconies need some work, but they have a nice view. I recommend upgrading to a suite as I did and get a nice room and space. The pool bar has reasonable prices (for the beach) and the location is near the "boardwalk" with free concerts, etc. The staff is nice and the hair conditioner they have in the room is superb! The beds are also comfortable. Good shopping is in the area also. I would come back again if I had a deal. I recommend going after the kids are back in school!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not horrible.”
Reviews.Author: KLyn74
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for Labor Day weekend and it was okay. The place is old and it needs to be updated but the location is good... right on the beach and only about a 10 min walk to the boardwalk. With that said, we won't come back here. We only stayed at this hotel because it was a travel deal from Groupon for 3 nights ($150 total). The place might have potential if the rooms & building can be renovated. The elevators are a joke. You never know if it's going up or down and they are SLOW. I carried all my stuff down 9 floors to the parking lot after checking out because trying to get on an elevator was not possible. Other than the location, the saving grace of this place is the staff. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The worst part of this place is the restaurant. It is terrible!!! It took over 30 mins to get our food (burger & chicken sandwhich) and there were only 2 other guests there. Turns out all the 'to go' orders were getting filled as we just sat there waiting & wondering what was going on. Don't order the cole slaw... it's GROSS! Actually, it was all pretty gross. The rooms really need a face lift and the bathrooms need to be updated. This was the first time we have ever seen painted shower tiles. I'm sure it was cheaper to paint over them than replace them but really...??? If you get a cheap rate and don't care too much about aesthetics, then this might be worth a shot because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “2nd year we've stayed here!!”
Reviews.Author: kmj005
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a little dated, my boyfriend and I have chosen this hotel for 2 of our vacations (2011 and 2012). Our room was clean, the beds were so COMFORTABLE, and the fridge and microwave worked. The door to the balcony could use some work, but it's nothing we couldn't get over. The elevators are much better this year and seemed to be working just fine during our stay. The only problem I have with this hotel is PARKING. You have to pay $8.50/day for a "resort fee" which includes pool towels, parking, wireless, etc. That's fine. However, there isn't always enough parking and sometimes you have to park across the 4 lane street (Atlantic Ave) and walk to and from the hotel. That parking lot is kind of sketchy, sketchy enough that they have a "security guard" manning in. We went out one morning to find an empty beer bottle next to our car, amongst a bunch of trash. The pool is very nice and clean. Its only open from 8am-11pm and it would be nicer if it was open later, but whatever. It's a nice place to hang out and swim. The view from the pool deck is also very nice and there is a window that goes to the bar from out there where you can order drinks. They also added a "fitness center", which includes a treadmill, bike, elliptical, and free weights. This hotel has some of the best views ever. The breakfast view from Atlantic Jacks is breathtaking and both times our room has had a nice view. We booked on Expedia this year and received free breakfast each morning that was delicious. We extended our trip through the hotel and they gave me a wonderful rate and included free breakfast. The lady that served breakfast was really nice and efficient at her job. We also really enjoyed the bar within the hotel and the staff there is very friendly. The bar is open crazy hours and will close if there aren't many people in there which kind of sucks. They also have a concierge service which offers COUPONS! The front desk staff was very nice. Jennifer always had a smile on her face and was good for conversation at 7am when we went to get our breakfast vouchers. The hotel is in a very nice location also. It's a block away from all of the local bars and just a 10 minute walk to the boardwalk, Bubba Gumps, etc. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just very gross!”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: This place is disgusting! We had a 2 night reservation made through expedia. We waited in line for over 30 minutes to check in. We got to our room and were grossed out by the mold in the bathroom, very rusty towel rack, hair on bathroom floor, and alot of dirt buildup in the bathroom. The internet wasn't working, the door handle for the sliding door going out onto the balcony was barely hanging on, literally with a single screw. The mattress pad was very small, like a twin size and the sheets were rough, We checked out within a couple of hours of checking in and after many phone calls and arguing with Expedia and the Manager, we were given a refund. Stay away! This place is so gross!

Reviews.Title: “OMG!”
Reviews.Author: Sherri M
Reviews.Content: After a long drive in terrible weather we checked into this hotel very late. We were very specific about our needs as my husband is handicapped. When we checked in we were told that there was a charge for towels, wi-fi and parking, an added expense that we were not informed about. The room was disgusting! Urine and feces on the toilet. Dirty bathtub. Carpet was gross. Pictures had been torn off of the wall with holes left. The frig had rusted out on the bottom and did not work. I could not keep my husbands insulin cold. One of the bedspreads had blood underneath it and they smelled so bad that I had to take them off of the bed. We were very concerned about the cleanliness of the beds. When I reported these things and more to the management they were very apologetic, but did nothing about it. The next morning the General manager approached me and offered me another room. I declined as the hotel did not meet my husbands handicapped needs. He then told me that they would not charge us for the night and gave me his direct number. He has not returned my calls and I was charged for the night. I would never stay at this flithy, shabby place again.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst!”
Reviews.Author: Allo18
Reviews.Content: I actually checked in last night and so far I can complain about 2 of the slowest elevators ever, major leak in the bathroom sink, my friend's room had a safe with no door...I mean this is the worst hotel stay I've ever stayed in. The rooms need updating: chipped paint on wall, stains on bathroom floor, and the big obsolete TVs (this isn't major issue but it's 2012)!! The hallway on my floor has the worst smell, like cigarrette-smoke-infused wetness. I would never stay here again especially since I traveled from NY.

Reviews.Title: “Look around some more.”
Reviews.Author: onetimek7
Reviews.Content: The location was absolutely perfect. Plenty of places to eat and see. The board walk is just a 10 min beach walk as is the market square. The hotel was clean and service was ok for a nice resort on the beach. The elevators would be the single reason I would never stay here again. My girlfriend and I timed the elevator wait and it was 5 minutes once we got on it would just goto whatever floor it wanted to. This was not a single isolated occurrence every time. Oh and itwas a bank of 3 elevators. All of the room.doors have a half inch gap so anything and everything going on in the hall ways is heard very clearly in your room. The hotel pool was nice and clean and the indoor bar was very cozy except closed at 10. The overall stay was nice but I expected much much more from a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking view”
Reviews.Author: tinky1242013
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel on our moveback to PA. The view was breathtaking from our room. The room was very clean and we had a private balcony. We had a chance to drive our car on the beach the next day and bake in the sun. I would recommend this to everyone as a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Beverly L
Reviews.Content: Our stay was absolutely wonderful! We enjoyed every minute! The staff was outstanding & always available to assist you. The pool area was very spacious & always clean with plenty of lounge chairs & tables for visitors. Our room was very clean & comfortable. The bathroom & balcony needed a little attention but nothing major. We noticed they were doing some upgrades & renovations but that did not interfere with any of the guests. There were plenty of shops & restaurants nearby that we could walk to. We met several of the staff members such as Kalie, Ms. Mo & the sweetest elderly gentleman (I only wish I would have gotten his name). They really know the true meaning of good Customer Service & welcome you as if you were an old friend. We are looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: AliGmunster81
Reviews.Content: I just want to start by saying..... Brittany at the front desk was really Nice. She welcomed us soon as we got to the desk, as there was a very long line. I took that as a great sign that we were at the right place. How many people would be standing in a line for this long, and still want to stay here? She was very helpful! There was also a girl named Kaelie (spelling might be off? Sorry) She was very helpful in telling me and my wife where we could go to grab not only a bite to eat, but also listen to great music! My wife "LOVES" reggae, and the place that Kaelie reccomended to us was perfect! The best was the atmosphere. We sat out on the deck part where there are only three steps between you and the sands of the beach. We watched the waves as we ate and listened to really great music. When we got back to the Hotel, I believe Kaelie was on her way out and even asked us how was dinner and the music. My wife just loved her, and said that she was the first person ever to steer us in the right direction of a great place to have fun, and ask about it and really mean it! We've been to some pretty pricy hotels in the past, with really up scale anemnities, and service that was outstanding. But She pretty much made us feel the welcome in our stay!! She told us that she would see us the next day and told us to have a great night! My wife was just so happy with the service, and at Atlantic Jacks I think it was called, we ate lunch there the next day and we shared a great chicken salad, and the fries are home cooked tasting. The only thing was that the bathroom was a little dingy, not dirty, but you can tell it was an older establishment. But hey, whos spending their vacation in the bathroom? Not US! The pool was really cool as it sat over looking the beach. It was a little cloudy, but that's because there were a lot of people getting in with suntan lotions and coming straight from the beach, so I guess you can't help that.... anything that me and my wife needed was taken care of, and in the morning, we decided that this was going to be our home, away from home when we come to Daytona Beach. Because of the service and attitudes of the girls at the front desk, and house keeping, we didn't notice any of the minor things that were a little less than perfect at the hotel! I would definately stay here, for business or just a little trip for my wife and I trying to have a little getaway. Thanks Kaelie & Brittany. (Sorry for the mispelled names :D )

Reviews.Title: “Nice change”
Reviews.Author: travelingcircus2012
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times in the past. During this stay I noticed new faces and the hotel is changing for the better. It has come under new management which has brought on the upgrades. One thing or should I say, person, that really was one of the best improvements was the front desk and Kaelie especially. She was such a delight and her personality is definately one in a million. Our checkin was just a great start to our stay!! Thank you Kaelie! The hotel has definately improved and has added new accommodations which were wonderful. We definately liked the room service! The elevators need tending to because they were rather slow but it was a sold out weekend and we were in no hurry. Overall it was a wonderful stay and we definately will be coming back and are looking forward to the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: ann815
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7/15-18/12The hotel could use a redecorating,repair,and replacement face lift. The location was great we walked every where to shop and eatery even played miniature golf. The beach outside was not crowded as by the boardwalk. The pool was not very clean so did not enjoy that part. I do agree with Inna C. It looks like they tried repainting the tile in bathtub and did not use the appropriate preparation and its peeling. I did have to buy mildew remover for the bath tub but overall it was clean. We had a oceanview room and it was pretty.The microwave could use a replacement. I did make tea every morning before heading to breakfast. There is no breakfast included in the price but there is a restaurant in the hotel. We did a groupon deal if it comes up again we will do again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tina R
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in Daytona Beach and stayed @ The Plaza Ocean Club Hotel 7/20/12 to 7/24/12. The hotel was great, the staff was EXCELLENT! A big THANK YOU to Kaelie and Tracy for all their help. We requested a roll away bed for an additional guest, went out to dinner, and the roll away was outside our hotel door.....what better service could you ask for!!!!!! If we needed anything all we had to do was ASK. The hotel room was nice and clean. Housekeeping kept everything tidy and if additional towels were needed, they provided them quickly. The elevator was a little slow, but hey...on vacation....who needs to be in a hurry! The pool was great, spacious and clean, and great for the kids. The restuarant was nice, the bar was great, room service if needed. Just an all around Great Hotel and a Great vacation. This was for a family of 5, 2 adults and 3 children. Would recommend this hotel to ANYONE going to Daytona and would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: rolandos51
Reviews.Content: We were there over the 4th of July!! I really thought for the price the hotel was pretty good. The biggest complaint that everyone had was the SLOW elevator. It wasn't as bad as that. I guess those who are in that big of a hurry can take the stairs. The pool was great, the beach was even better, and they have a bar open all day and night!! Our room was clean....I'd go back and stay again. We had one incident and the management took care of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brianna B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one short night, overall we really loved the place. I was hesitant bc of some of the previous reviews, however I have worked in the hotel business before and understand that those reviews were placed during a very busy time in Daytona and it's tough to please everyone during those busy and hectic times. We stayed on Saturday night and arrived to fireworks out by the pier which is very close to the hotel. We then were able to swim until midnight which the kids loved the lit up pool. We did not eat at the restaurant but they stayed busy so the food must have been good. We did arrive late so the lady at the fd let us check out at 12 for no extra charge, when we checked out they were very kind and quick. We will be staying here plenty more. Con: elevator very slow

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bellacali
Reviews.Content: Great location, great ocean view hotel, bathroom need to be updated and elevators were very slow otherwise great stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A 2-day stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike O
Reviews.Content: I was here for two days... I must say the staff does a great job at trying their best to maintain a older hotel. For a short stay on a budget, it's not a bad hotel. The one thing that I will complain about is you have a better chance of winning the lottery than catching an elevator quickly. The rooms need some minor repairs but overall clean.

Reviews.Title: “The Family Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza Ocean Club July 6-July 10, 2012. When we first pulled up the appearence was very nice, property looked clean, the front desk was very helpful. The room on the 7th floor was nice and clean and we had a perfect view of the ocean. Throughout our stay there where several employees that I ran into out in the halls and they all were very pleasant and you could tell they loved working there. Meet some folks on the property and they said they have been coming there for 13 years. All and all is was a great experience and we will most definetly be going back next year. Thank you Plaza Ocean Club and it's entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Shoesaremycalling
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome for the price paid. The room, though dated, was very clean. The bathroom definitely needs remodeling, but it was clean as well. I used a Groupon for this trip, so breakfast was included. I ordered fresh for three of the days and there was a breakfast buffet for the last day I was there. The food was fresh and tasty. The service at the restaurant was great as well. The pool was kept very clean, and the location was perfect! My only complaint was in terms of towels and washclothes. Housekeeping never provided enough, so I had to keep calling and going to the front desk. Otherwise, the stay was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but the hotel is in disrepair”
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: Came in for the Zero Coke 400. The staff were pleasant and helpful, especially the restaurant personnel. However, the front desk was slow, the lobby area is in need of a good cleaning including glass doors with 2-day old fingerprints, corners laden with spider webs and crumbs left under tables and chairs. The carpet in the hallway is in need of a thorough cleaning. We had two rooms and neither were what we ordered. The beddings looked clean and crisp but the carpet was dirty, something a good vacuum might have remedied. The walls were cracked, paint peeling, dead spiders attached to the ceiling and the walls in the bathroom were dirty. Used wash cloths were found in the shower and hair was found on the floor. There are hidden fees to which you should be aware regarding the room safe. If you do not ask the front desk to remove the "convenience" fee you will be charged a daily rate. I will never stay at this property again

Reviews.Title: “No place like home!”
Reviews.Author: Penelane
Reviews.Content: Good hotel only two problems, elevators are slooooow and sleeping on the beds is like sleeping a floor. The beds were extremely hard. Other than that we got what we wanted out of the hotel, a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Plaza Ocean Club June 28-July 2, 2012. The resort was an exciting place to stay with lots of activities for my family. The pool was a big hit with my kids. Everything was really clean, so we felt comfortable letting the kids roam. The restaurant was handy and the food was good and a decent value. All of the staff was friendly and acted quickly on all of our requests. The hotel manager spoke to us in the mornings at breakfast. We will miss those beautiful sunrises and strolls along the beach. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Struggling to find anything nice to say”
Reviews.Author: NZSailfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Daytona weekend. Checkin was abit chaotic. We were put into rm 317 which was clearly not one of the renovated ones. So here is the list of negatives. Large hole in the corner of the microwave so when you turned it on you could see into it thru the hole. Power tripped off the first day so no TV till maintenance turned up. Had to find the housekeepers every afternoon and ask them to do our room. Mildew over the outside of the fridge. Deck furniture aging and dirty. Windows were so grubby it was hard to see through them. The tap in the bath would not turn off and dripped continually, you could hear dogs barking in the neighboring rooms and the ice machine ran water for the whole time we were there. One of our beds had a spring that kept popping out and the other one had a huge sag in the middle. Pool had a number of drunk people smoking as they swam with accompanying butts. The lifts were incredibly slow. The parking was mostly disabled and beach parking so finding parking next to the building was a real challenge. On checkout the desk clerk was busy with her head in the computer and did not make eye contact or speak to me for over 3 minutes. Left me feeling very undervalued, as though I did not exist and certainly was not important. I would have told her about the faults in the room so something could be done but was so frustrated by her attitude I just wanted to get out of there. The good thing for the hotel was the maintenance man was really helpful. You can do better for your money than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back in a million years”
Reviews.Author: Abbie Z
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Plaza Ocean club was a very miserable one. When we first showed up to check in we had to wait ten minutes until the front desk staff was done joking around with drunk guests from the pool, acting completely unprofessional. Once we checked in we went up to our room via elevator in which all the ceramic tile on the floor of it was cracked and broken and was incredibly slow. Once we arrived to our floor we stepped off the elevator into a dingy hallway with vomit stained carpet and it smelled like cat urine. We got to our door and it looked like someone had tried to kick it down it was so incredibly dirty and scufffed. We then entered our room where it just got worse. Starting with the bathroom there was mold all over the wallpaper border, the tub did not drain at all, the floor had black hair all over it and looked like no one had cleaned it, the blow dryer was missing and it appeared that it had been ripped off the wall. It was disgusting. The bed spreads had cigarette holes burned into them, there were bugs all over the floor and there was an odd smell in the room. The balcony which was suppose to provide a beautiful view of the ocean was covered in bird droppings and since we had a view of the roof we could see mounds of trash that guests had thrown off their balcony, liquor bottles, towels, beer cans, food, wrappers, you name it. Again, very disgusting. This hotel makes it very obvious that they cater to the spring break partiers and everyone who works there is completely unprofessional and rude. Everything from the front desk, to the pool was dirty, that hotel needs to be torn down and replaced. If you are looking for a nice vacation spot this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is wonderful; great service at a great price - we will return!!!”
Reviews.Author: zionite0001
Reviews.Content: My family spent 3 days here on our vacation July 2012... we LOVED it! From the moment we arrived, we were treated with respect, friendliness, and given whatever we needed. I know some reviews have mentioned that it's an older hotel, but our room was clean, spacious, and well maintained, especially for such a great rate. The service was impeccable, and SOOOOO friendly, which means a lot to us. Even the ocean-VIEW room (vs. ocean FRONT) was all the beachfront view that we needed. The pool was great, very clean, and I just can't say enough about the service. Did I mention the service was GREAT?! (LOL) WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “It grows on you.”
Reviews.Author: kids-in-2-centuries
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a groupon June 12-June 16. I upgraded to an ocean front room when I made the reservation. When I checked in I was told that the room I booked (two double beds) was not available due to "damage" and they had put us in an ovean front room with one King bed and a pull out couch. I as disappointed about the change, but they discounted the upgrade by $10.00 per night, which I appreciated. When we got to our room on the 6th floor it was clean but not up to the standards of a room we would normally stay in. If I had paid full price for the stay I likely would have checked out right then and went someplace else. The shower head was pulled from the wall, corner molding pulled from the wall, faucet was leaking/dripping and the room just felt run-down. You can read the other reviews about the place needing updates, I agree. THe best part of the room was the view of the ocean, and my children really enjoyed that. My older son appreciated the free wi-fi and it worked well for him. The pool area was great and my younger son and I spent most of our time there. They really seem to put alot of effort into making sure he outside of this hotel looks nice. I would suggest that they do all the pool maintenance and cleaning of the area before the pool opens at 8 am. I had to move all of my stuff one morning so that a maintenance guy could hose down/wash the windows in the meeting area. I think he should have done this before the pool opened. I found the front desk/restaurant/bar staff to be very friendly and interesting to talk to. The staff is likely the best part of the hotel, followed by the pool area. In the end, I am glad I got over my initial dislike of the place because it ended up to be a good stay. I hope they continue with the upgrades and improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kelly W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed four nights and had a great time. Our room was clean upon arrival, and the staff made sure all of our daily needs were met. We stayed in an ocean view room on the 11th floor and the views were spectacular! The pool had plenty of chairs and was just steps from the beach! The location was awesome, walking distance to the the ocean walk and lots of restaurants. I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good For Price”
Reviews.Author: TJ557
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms here last week of June and were satisfied, Front desk acommadated us staying near each other. Stayed on 8th floor, Which was just Painted and room was very nice.Desk Personel and house keeping were very friendly and gave the extra. Location is good near Pier. Parking was limited and Elevators slow, But not much of a problem Mid week. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay on vacation”
Reviews.Author: HannaCowart
Reviews.Content: The parking and waiting on the elevators is bad but other than that it's very nice! The rooms have everything you need, are comfortable, the beds are soft, and the view of the each is beautiful! The shower is a little rusty and the walls need to be painted in the rooms. The pool is great and the beach and boardwalk are close. I had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't beleive all the negative reviews...”
Reviews.Author: keltorr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Plaza Club a few weeks ago using our Groupon. We had already decided to upgrade our Ocean VIew room to an Ocean Front room & I am so glad we did. The view was incredible from the 11th floor. The room seemed to have been updated recently. The tiles in the shower and bathroom looked new. The room was spacious with what appeared to be new beddings and pillows. Some parts of the hotel were dated, but come on..this is Daytona. Most of Daytona is dated, in my opinion. The pool was nice & we were literally right on the beach. The hotel restaraunt was average with good service. All of the staff at this hotel were extremely welcoming and accomidating. The only issue we had was staying the same time as the First Baptist Church of Tifton youth group (of what appeared to be 100+ teenagers). Before making it to our room a fight broke out amongst these kids and I had to call for secuirty. Secuirty showed up promptly and worked hard to resolve this issue. I do believe the hotel staff and other guests were beyond ready for this group to leave!! :-) This is in no way the staffs fault. They appoligized over and over again. I believe a manager named John(?) even gave my husband his personal cell phone number in case we had any other issues. After the group left, there were no more issues. Again, I cannot say enough good about the staff at the hotel. If you have a problem, let them know. I feel sure they will work hard to correct it. Also, I had read many of these reviews before our trip and was a bit worried, no need to be! We had a nice visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but issues with hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Guy H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, has really good views, and the pool is pretty nice but leaves much to be desired in other areas. Our room initially had a strong mold/mildew smell, a little overwhelming at first. The cleaning staff unplugged our fridge and we didn't know until the next morning when all of our stuff was warm. They decided the middle of the summer (and possibly the busiest time of the year) was a great time to paint the rooms, so our whole floor was being painted (nice medley of mold, mildew, and paint fragrances welcomed us every time we came back to the hotel). Parking is hit or miss. The staff seemed pretty friendly overall, no real complaints with anyone. Hotel restaurant service seemed pretty slow, but they only had one server at the time. There was what looked to be visible molding on the bathroom ceiling. Overall the place needs work, and it looks like they are doing renovations so that's good. We got our rate at half off so we just went with the cards that were dealt to us and still enjoyed our stay. Depending on what is important to you, this place could be a pass or play.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz Carlton for sure”
Reviews.Author: Gister
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Plaza Ocean Club with a purchased 3 day Groupon and it is indeed in need of some major renovation. We were on the 2nd floor so elevator was not an issue but the view was not as good. The groupon deal was a good one for the price. Only thing I had to pay was the daily service charge of around $8 or something a day. Parking and $45 food and bar credit for the 3 days was included.to the onsite restaurant. Not much choice on the menu and pricey for what you get. Couldn't say enough GOOD things about the staff, very polite and helpful ( left my wallet by accident after playing a game of pool ) . Location was great and because is was a mid week stay parking wasn't an issue. Right now I probably wouldn't pay full price to stay there but I have another 3 day groupon stay planned in Aug so I'll give it another try.I'll probably try to upgrade to one of the corner oceanfront rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: Todd W
Reviews.Content: A friendly staff greets you and ensures that you understand the "resort fee", which includes towels at the beach, Internet and parking. However, don't get confused, this is NO RESORT and NO CLUB!! For the price I expected an above average hotel (not Kimpton, but something around a Hilton Garden Inn level). To begin, the restaurant was closed at my arrival at 915pm, even though the signs indicated it stayed open until 10. The room was not a kitchenette as advertised...it had an old refrigerator with a microwave on top...neither of which I would consider using. The floors in the hallways were disgustingly dirty and that continued into the room. The room was so nasty that I made sure no clothes ever came close to the floor or bed...argh!! Not a good sleep either, bed was very old and very uncomfortable. The shower was also gross and the shower head I have not seen since I was in the Army. I think it is some kind of low flow, but high pressure that will just peel the skin right off!! I think years of Spring Break parties have taken their toll on this place. Staff kept this from being a Terrible rating.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we only stayed one night!!!”
Reviews.Author: duaneandseason
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night to have a relaxing beach day before we took the kids to Disney World. The hotel went from bad to worse and kept getting worse. When we went to check in the hotel staff was not friendly, our room was not ready so they gave us a card and ask us to call in randomly and they would tell us when it was ready. It took forever for the room to be ready. When we got there the elevators are extremely slow and we only saw one set for the entire hotel. Our room was somewhat clean, but we had no washcloths, when we ask they said it would be awhile but someone would bring them up. It indeed took forever for us to get a total of 3 washcloths. I will say we did have a nice view and the price was ok as we reserved the room through priceline.com. Around 9:30 I heard a lot of screaming outside followed by sirens. I looked off the balcony and saw a fire truck getting their hoses and gear ready to fight a fire. Someone had set the hotel garbage area on fire. You would have thought we would have been warned or ask to leave the hotel but we never heard a word from the front desk. We were on the 9th floor so this was a little scary for us since we had no idea if we needed to evacuate or not. I do give some credit to the hotel management because they were working very hard with the fire department to get the fire out and clean up before the guest woke up to see the mess the next morning. We were never told anything when we checked out of the hotel or even given an explanation on what happen. This was not the worst hotel I have ever experienced but will not stay here again. Also parking was terrible!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Vacation at the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Carla A
Reviews.Content: At first the Hotel seems very nice ,The lobby is very nice ,But once you get upstairs it gets bad. The carpets in the halls are very nasty . The wall in the shower had been painted and chipping off. Their are roaches around the soda machine on the 6th floor next to the laundry.Their was a dumpster fire when we stayed their ,The hotel was full of smoke . It was very scary . Tried to talk to girl at front desk at check out about it , She just brushed me aside like no big deal to check in the next sucker . Will never go back . And advise all not to !

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful experience at the Plaza Ocean Club Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ97
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another wonderful experience at the Plaza Ocean Club Hotel. The front desk employees were so good and helpful in our booking and checking in experience. Hotel was clean and was full. The pool was so clean and refreshing. Our room was excellent and very clean. Only snag we had was one of the elevators went down and since the hotel was at capacity, trying to get an elevator was a long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puppylover999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely run down. Ants in the room, dirty carpets, rusty fixtures, shower tiles have been painted and were chipping.

Reviews.Title: “If you like mediocrity and a bit of danger, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Autumn_W_28
Reviews.Content: I bought two Groupons to this hotel, one for four nights and one for three nights, so we stayed for one week total (me, my husband, 10-month old and 6-year old). I read some of the reviews and they were fairly positive so I was surprised at how disappointed I was. First, the hotel is old and it looks and smells moldy; they are renovating so maybe they will take care of the smell. The receptionists at check-in were unpleasant at best. They did not make eye contact and acted like we were a nuisance. We were not told about any features of the hotel - the pool, the restaurant, the bar, amenities, etc. Our room was okay. It had a kitchenette, which was nice, but the fridge leaked so whatever you put in there got filled with water within hours. The freezer was so full of ice it could not be used. There was a microwave, sink and shelving. The room was a decent size and looked fairly clean but the bathroom had mold on the walls and the tile in the shower was literally crumbling. The water coming out of the shower was hot and came out fast - a big plus, but we did not have a tub stopper so we had a heck of a time giving our baby a bath. On a least two occasions, housekeeping did not leave us fresh towels or coffee and when we called the front desk to ask for some they told us they only had one working dryer and we would have to wait until the towels were washed. The patio was small but it faced the ocean which was nice. What wasn't nice were the other tenants that were smoking all around us which made sitting on the patio (and by the pool) unpleasant. The hotel is within walking distance of the boardwalk and ocean shops. The pool was clean but the shallow, three-foot area for kids was very small which made it difficult for my six-year-old to play. There was a one-foot baby pool that was filled with stagnant water - gross. The restaurant on site, Atlantic Jacks, was terrible. We had Groupons to use so we decided to have dinner there the first night. We were the only people there (which should have clued us in that this was not a good place to eat). We ordered and never got our food. We waited 20 minutes, I asked the server where our food was and she laughed. My daughter got bored and crawled under the table and announced that there was gum under the table. We got up and left. We decided to use our Groupons at the bar instead - they didn't have wine and the bartender didn't have what he needed to make most of the drinks they advertised on their sign. He got irritated when I asked him to put cherries in my daughter's Shirley Temple. The bar is connected to the restaurant so if you eat in the restaurant, be prepared to smell smoke. We found out on our sixth day there that they had a breakfast buffet. We spent $30 for, basically, a continental breakfast - cold bacon, cold sausage, toast, danishes covered in fruit flies from the bar, fruit, hard biscuits and hard, cold waffles. The elevators, stairs and parking are a MAJOR safety concern and I will be writing a letter to their corporate office about my observations. The stairwells run on the outside of the hotel and the doors leading to the stairs and to the rooms are unlocked so anyone with ill intentions can hide there. As a woman, I didn't feel safe using the stairs. Plus, they reeked of urine. Secondly, the elevators are very dangerous. The doors close very quickly and the safety feature that lets you wave a hand in front of the door to keep it from closing was not working so my family and I almost had arms and legs crushed by the door, literally. With two kids, bikes, a stroller, a beach tent, etc., it took a minute to get off the elevator and one time the door closed on my arm as I was holding my daughter's hand. She was still in the elevator and I had to put my body in the door of the elevator and push it open. My daughter was screaming and I was completely panicked. The same thing happened to my husband. The other safety concern I had was that we had to park across the street in the overflow lot. I did not feel safe walking there by myself. My husband had to make numerous trips there and he was often stopped by homeless people asking for money. And, it was across the street from Lollipops Gentlemen's Club. Not something I want my six-year-old to see. On our last night there, someone set fire to the dumpster that was right below our room. It could have easily caught the hotel on fire. No one was alerted, the smoke alarms did not go off but the next day, the entire dumpster and surrounding wooden shed it was encased in was burnt to a crisp. Other observations - The pool did not have a bar and the bar did not open until 5; no one was monitoring the pool so there were a few times where unruly kids were carrying on and being obnoxious; we got hassled by some guy as we were entering the building one night (not sure if he was staying there or if he was homeless); dogs are allowed so you may be kept awake by barking; elevators are slow (there are only two); the beach in front of the hotel was great - clean and quiet; the air conditioner fan ran all night which was great for us; the beds and pillows are very firm. We will not be staying at this hotel again or recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: DISFAN315
Reviews.Content: We decided we wanted to get away for the weekend and decided on Daytona Beach. We were able to get a good rate for the hotel, but were a little leery after reading some of the other reviews. I'm glad we took a chance. All the rooms have some view of the ocean, which was beautiful. The balcony was small and the neighbors air conditioning vent is out there, but it wasn't dripping water, so not a big deal. Being on the 10th floor on the boardwalk side, we were able to watch the Saturday night fireworks from the balcony - what a great view. The room must have been freshly painted. When we first walked in, the smell was a little strong, but that subsided over our stay. The bathroom needs a little work, but everything was clean. The carpet appeared to be brand new as well. Common areas in and around the hotel were clean. Biggest downfall in the place is the elevators. They are slow and somewhat random. If the elevator appears at your floor, but is going in the opposite direction, you'll either need to get on and take the ride, or wait for the door to close and hit the wall button again because it will no longer be lit. Other concerns were that the elevators and hallways get very warm and there isn't a lot of parking available for guests (there is additional parking about a block away though). Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Anthony E
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Plaza Ocean Club 3 times this year and have received tremendous accommodations from the customer service team, specifically, Jennifer. She is polite, courteous and puts on a welcoming smile. She is very customer oriented and ensures to go the extra mile for customers. This is a hotel that i would recommend not only for the service but the convenience of the pool, live music and quick access to the beach. The rooms were also clean with staff providing extra towels, necessities and accommodations. I will continue to stay at the Plaza Ocean Club Hotel. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “No reason at all to complain!”
Reviews.Author: Xtina39
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I just spent 3 nights at this hotel. Before we left I had read some very negative reasons and was a little concerned. Dont be! The room was clean, the stafff was very helpful. The location is great for walking everywhere. We had a balcony room and even with the rain we sat out there and enjoyed the view. The pool area is very nice and the breakfast buffet was tasty. Peple complained the hotel was dated...most of Daytona is dated, this place had character. People complained about the elevator being slow...your on vacation, whats your rush? Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie22
Reviews.Content: We went to Daytona for a girls "staycation" weekend. We found Plaza Ocean Club Hotel through Groupon for a price that we could not turn up, I believe it was about $180 including all taxes for the entire 3 night stay. It broke down to $11.25 per night per person. Amazing! We were not disappointed as we definitely got our moneys worth. If we had to pay full price, we would have selected a newer hotel. The location was in walking distance to many restaurants and clubs, not far from the Boardwalk activities. The building was older but sort of surface remodeled, there was an strange odor of old mold and stale throughout. Our rooms were large enough with a mini fridge and microwave. No premium TV channels, DVD player or movie rentals available. The beds were very firm, to the point of being uncomfortable. But the bedding was clean. Tip: Do not leave anything on your bed when you leave in the morning. Housekeeping will not touch your bed to change the bedding. Our bathtub/shower dripped all the time and the shower head was about 5' high and coming out of the wall. The floor flooded with every shower, even with the splash guards. The inside bar was small but friendly bartenders! No poolside bar which was disappointing. The restaurant was pretty bad, we only ate breakfast there. Watered down Maxwell House tasting coffee and blase buffet with very greasy under-cooked bacon. (The Cracked Egg is a few miles south on A1A-now THAT's a breakfast). There is a food truck parked behind the hotel at the beach that a lot of guests were using instead. No Spa Service All in all, for what we paid, we would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean but worn”
Reviews.Author: cweldon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run down. I did see a review that stated the hotel was being renovated but I saw no signs of that. It was clean and in a very good location. I was able to get it at a very good price but I would think twice about the trade off next time.

Reviews.Title: “Plaza Ocean Roach Club Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BC B
Reviews.Content: Ok here is what happen. We had made reservations at the hotel. Well we got to the first room and the key didn't work and there was a dog n the next room that kept barking so my wife goes down to the desk n let them know about the key and the dog. Well she comes back up n tells me they gave us a room (the second room) on the fourth floor. Well we go up there and the first thing that hits you is the whole floor smells like rotten carpets. So we put our bags n the room n leave. Well we get back at like ten at night n go to the room take showers. Shower head was pulled from wall call front desk maintenance comes up and pushes it back into the wall. Well I got up n go to the bathroom at one n kill two roaches. Then try to go back to bed. I lay down and hear all this noise from the next door at a party so I turn on the tv and fall back to sleep. Well at 2:13am some dummy decides to have a party in the parking lot and turns his stereo up and wakes us up. I call the front desk & they say they can't do anything about it cause they are in the parking lot next door. I hang up the phone & I see a roach on the night stand & kill it then call the front desk back & ask if they can call the cops n she says no so I call the cops so I can sleep We get up in the morning and look for another hotel n the manger called because we called our travel company to get our points n money back so our vendor calls the hotel. So the manager gives us a third room with a free breakfast everyday for the rest of our stay, we were not n there 5 minutes and killed five roaches my wife called the manager to come up to the room to see the roach crawling on the wall. The manager told us they didn't have roaches they were palmetto bugs. Manager didn't come up to the room she called back and said she was handling other issues but she has the cleaning manager looking into another room. We said no thanks and check out. Our stay was 1 June 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Louise L
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Plaza...........Must say we did get off on a bad first night.. Had reserved two rooms ajoining.. First they were not and they were on different sides of the hall.. Girl at front desk said they were not even rooms, plus the fact my room had two ajoining rooms and one door was unlocked! Room was not as good as expected.. mind you this was the 9th floor. So we go back down and since it is Memorial Day weekend were no rooms open. Later had front desk guy Engune helping us out.. He worked really hard to get it right.. Next morning got a call from Jennifer front desk and YES they got us a room on 10th floor.........It was perfect..Had the rooms we wanted.View was wonderful of the boardwalk.. We also got free coupons for breakfast buffet too. This was really good to, hot foods, fruit,cereal......... The other one other problem was that hotel did not tell us there is a resort fee daily, but after talking to them they took it out our bill... All in all is a very nice place...............Would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: michelle p
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just basic. The outside looks impressive, but the inside is more like an average hotel. The room was a little worn down and dated. Its plus was the great view of the ocean. The elevators were really slow. Service in the restaurant was also slow. At lunch we got food (snack foods) to go and ate at the pool. The pool was really nice. There was also a small kiddie pool. Plenty of chairs. Access to the beach was steps away from the hotel. This hotel is also within walking distance to restaurants, movie theater, and pier.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Russell K
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over a long weekend... the place was great. Clean rooms, great staff, super location and the price was in our budget. We especially liked the fact that the pool was practically on the beach, so it was great being on the beach without getting all sandy! Would recommend the place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Great View”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: We got a corner room on one of the upper floors and the view was spectacular. The staff was great, and while some parts of the hotel are a little dated, it seems they are working hard on the updates. The Bar downstairs was fun and the amenities just fine. The slice of beach is really terrific! Well worth the cost - we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “family weekend getaway in Daytona Beach, Florida”
Reviews.Author: gschaafs66
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to Daytona Beach. We selected this hotel based on the location and the ratings. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the staff top notch. We had a great experience for the three days we stayed and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Liv2dans
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in the area and none can compare to this one. The hotel is very clean, from the lobby to the rooms. It has a fresh feel and nice clean scent that many other hotels in the area struggle with. We found the amenities to be more than expected with a larger than normal room, a fridge, a microwave and a coffee pot. There was also a cute little restaurant and bar with access to the pool for the days that we decide to relax by the beach. The staff was incredibly friendly and extremely helpful! It's located right on the beach and its only a short walk to mall/movie theaters. I would recommend this hotel above all others that I have stayed at in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “great local hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toni B
Reviews.Content: I live in the area but have visited the hotel on numerus occasions. We held a gathering for our family there and couldn't have had a more pleasant experience. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to make the day special, so much so that we are doing a family reunion (100-150 people) in August at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: The staff make me continue to come back I have stayed there over 50 nights in the last year. The motel is in a great location with nice views from the rooms. Outside is very well maintained with a nice pool, restraunt and bar. The rooms and inside hallways are in need of immediate overhauls. But by far the staff I have meet and dealt with is by far eneough to overcome any negatives. Pet Freiendly!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New Owners, New Management Co has arrived!”
Reviews.Author: jollyranger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 23-27, 2012. I was pleased with some parts of this hotel. It is right on the ocean/beach and has a very nice pool and deck area, the lounges are comfortable and not hot. The outside front is very inviting. There is a restaurant in it which serves breakfast and lunch and I ate at the restaurant for 3 lunches and they were pretty good and priced reasonably. My check-in went well, but check-out wasn't too good since there were long lines because a huge amount of people were checking in in groups. The room I had was a small king size room and there was a hole in the wall, the bathroom needs updating. They had painted over the tile in the bathtub/shower area which was peeling and the sink stopper wouldn't work correctly. They obviously have purchased new towels that were just great. The bed was not comfortable and the pillows were horrible. The TV watching was hard since the screen was dark at times to see the picture. They had a microwave and refrigerator which was nice. This wasn't a great room, as I travel a lot and so I had said something about it to the waitress, who inturn told the new Mgr of the hotel and he called me. He told me that they are remodeling this hotel as there are new owners and new management company and for me to come back again in the fall to see the updates on the remodeling. They are putting in new carpeting, new beds, all new bedding/pillows, new TV's and the following year they will be remodeling the bathrooms. He sent a crew into my room after I checked out to fix the hole in the wall. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful, as well the waitress. I was told they will turn this hotel into a DoubleTree establishment. So I will go back there in the fall to see all the new changes. It looks like they redid the blacktop on the property so parking is easy, however, the night before I left I could barely find a parking space on the property and saw a couple coming to a car in the back and so I waited and got their space. There is another overflow lot about a block away, but I am recovering from heart surgery and walking that distance is too much for me. The one nice part of the room is that all the rooms give you a view of the ocean, since it is built at an angle, so you look out your sliding glass doors and see the ocean perfectly, which is very nice to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Daytona Beach worn-out & tacky”
Reviews.Author: flgirl34709
Reviews.Content: We were in Daytona Beach for a wedding. This hotel is relatively clean, but just worn out & tired. Old style bedding, basic cheap-style beds, stained tub & bathroom floor. Pool area passable, but unremarkable. Paint chipped off railing around pool terrace area. Service - mediocre. The quality of the hotel did not match the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: BuckTravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot and have never felt the need to right a bad review until now. Our first mistake was letting ourselves get lured to Florida by a travel club whereas we had to visit 3 locations in Florida; one of them being Daytona. This is the hotel that we HAD to stay at. After waiting a few hours to get checked in, we finally made it to our room to find it pretty shabby. It looks more like a dorm room, with rusty old microwave and bar frig but we thought it is only for 2 nights - how bad could it be? After finding all kinds of junk on the carpet, including a pill, we headed down to the pool to try to relax before going to dinner. The pool area is pretty basic and after sitting there for awhile, I went into our beach bag to find it soaking wet. I thought it might have been my water bottle leaking but it was actually coming up out of the ground. Not quite sure what it was that was coming out of the ground, just hoping it was only water. When we went back to the room to get ready for dinner, we were going to shower until we saw how utterly disgusting it was. The floor of the tub is totally black and they tried to cover it up with a bath mat. The tiles and grout have been painted numerous times with different tints of paint, probably trying to disguise mold and mildew. No way were we going to shower in there. The walls and doors have all been damaged and instead of fixing them properly, they are just patched with paint (that doesn't even match) slapped over it. After managing to get somewhat freshened up, we headed out to find somewhere to eat. After asking at reception for some recommendations, we still had no idea what was good in the area. We figured there must be something within walking distance so headed north. After a few minutes, we felt very unsafe and turned around. We finally came upon The Oyster Bar which looked like it was ok. After dinner we headed back to the hotel and thought we would sit on the balcony and enjoy a drink while looking over the ocean. As soon as we stepped onto the balcony, our feet stuck to the ground. It seems that many of the spring breakers can't figure out how to get over the raised edge without spilling their drinks and the cleaning staff doesn't seem to clean out there or even the doors for that matter. You couldn't see out of them as they were totally covered with finger marks and god knows what else. We figured we might as well head to bed as we had to go to the presentation early in the morning. After about 2 hours of restless sleep, I awoke to scratching my legs. We had checked the bed quickly for bed bugs when we first checked in but didn't notice any. Obviously, we missed them because my legs were covered in bites. Not being able to get back to sleep, I was checking for other hotels to stay in for the next night until I was so exhausted I fell back to sleep until being woken up by 3 rounds of spring breakers coming in around 5:00 am hooting and hollering. I didn't care what we had to do, we were not staying there another night. When we told the travel club that we refused to stay there another night, they were gracious enough to have us moved to the hotel next door, The Plaza Resort and Spa but we had to pay an extra $30. At that point, I would have paid anything. Unless you are strictly there to party and don't care where you sleep, I would stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: fudungo
Reviews.Content: We got the room on a Groupon for $159.00 for three nights and were able to put two Groupons together make it a six night stay! We also got vouchers (from the groupon) to hotel restaurant and bar and were actually able to use them for alcohol! AWESOME! The view, the pool and the beach were absolutely beautiful. The staff were all very helpful as well, bartenders (Ryan and Scott), Front desk (Hope and Kaelie), and the maids were great too. Others are correct, the hotel is dated and the bathrooms definitely need to be redone, but we knew we weren't staying at the Waldorf Astoria!

Reviews.Title: “Not My Style”
Reviews.Author: TVL4ME
Reviews.Content: I can say that the location on the beach was good, but the hotel is dated. The front desk was cordial;however, upon entering my room there was leftover bits of snacks on the floor (m&m, fritos, and paper). I decided to let that slide. I did see roaches the first day that I got there and I asked the front desk to please spray. This hotel may be fine for some;however, it was my first and last visit. Unless some significant changes are made, I would not go back, even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy to the beach...”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitravels01
Reviews.Content: A great spot for the beach, just make sure you are not there for the Bikers Week.. Great to see all the bikes but incredibly noisy at night with bikes cruising till the early hours. And if you want a good sleep dont be there while the spring breakers are, while friendly and approachable some of them want to party till 4 in the morning and don't mind if they keep you awake while they do. Staff are quick to deal with any problems. Rooms are average and well worn, despite that still comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful. As said a good stay for the price just pick your time....

Reviews.Title: “1st Floor is nice :)”
Reviews.Author: denverdallas
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying on the first floor in a room that walked right out to the pool. Restaurants were good and so was the diner within walking distance. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for vacation.”
Reviews.Author: EthansMommy8310
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot, right on the beach! Some of the employees were very friendly and enthusiastic while others were pretty monotone.. Room looked pretty good, no bugs, tears or leaking faucets, there was however some peeling in the paint around the a/c but nothing major. The bathroom and room was clean even though we checked in early, the housekeeping staff actually hadn't known we checked in early and beought the rest of our towels but they were friendly and did their job quickly and neatly. The only thing I would never recommend is to go on a family vacation during Spring Break/ the start of Bike Week, very crowded, everywhere! But, at another time if I were to come back to Daytona Beach for vacation I would definitely consider staying at Ocean Plaza Club Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have I bothered to write a review (good or bad) about anything in my life, but I'm going out of my way this time to make sure I do my part to try to save someone from having my experience at POCH. This place is a filthy mess. I literally almost died on one of their shaky elevators. They have ZERO ethical standards....they rented what seemed to be the entire hotel to children that were parentless from the ages of 13-17. They were all running around completely drunk running up and down the halls, packing the elevator to go up and down to ever different party'. It was like a jungle. And let me tell you this, I am a 31 year old who LOVES to party. I'm not some old grumpy guy!! What I was seeing made me blush!! The young little drunk parentless girls were dressed in the smallest/tightest clothes I've ever seen. It was all just indescribable. Obviously the party went on through the night when they got home from whatever trashy club Daytona offers right next door. I'm not sure how they could knowing let all of this go on. JUST DON'T DO THIS TO YOURSELF!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for picky travelers”
Reviews.Author: Pam S
Reviews.Content: Even though I had read the reviews, I was disappointed with the wear of the hotel. It started with the dated and worn decor in the lobby / elevator and continued to the room. We stayed in room 720. The bathroom sink was cracked, the tub leaked, the toliet would continue to run, all the fixtures were rusty, there was unpainted dry wall repair, the decor was worn and mismatched. My husband was perfectly happy with the room but I would have preferred a more up to date room. The ice machine on our floor did not work. The staff was friendly enough but didn't interact with them much during our 5 day stay The room was clean, the view was great, parking was good but is an additional cost. The restaurant was okay, the only reason we patronized it was because we had coupons for it. The location was perfect. The pool area was clean and well maintained. I would only stay here again if I couldn't get a decent rate else where.

Reviews.Title: “Older but clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: DeeJackson62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, so furniture, appliances, etc are also older. BUT it was clean! All balconies face ocean, patio door, 2 chairs and a small table. PERFECT The staff were really nice, effiencient and helpful. Never a frown. Cleaning staff were amazing! We would leave for breakfast, come back an room was fresh and clean! The only complaint was no water pressure in the bathroom sink, but plenty of power in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room...”
Reviews.Author: gramma06_11
Reviews.Content: Booked with this hotel 10 months in advance requesting ocean view. Arrived and was told nothing available. We were disappointed and I asked not to be put in one of those run downed rooms you see in trip advisor pics. They said they had nothing like that all rooms had been renovated. Well our street view room was renovated but these rooms come with terrible street noise. When we mentioned this at the front desk they said that this is a common complaint. And my question is why don't they go something about it??! Maybe if enough people complained they would. Anyway met another couple staying here and they had a room on the 11th floor that was in terrible shape. Must be the one the nasty pics on trip advisor are from I told them I would add that to my review. I should mention that we were here during race week with a sports travel pkg & the front desk tried to tell us that rooms were assigned in blocks to the travel pkg. we found this not to be true. Found out later they gave oceAn view rooms to race team people Who front desk stated they came in unexpected To pacify us they told us Sunday nite after race 95rooms would be vacated and they would move us to ocean view well that didn't happen when the race was cancelled they moved those people back into rooms they had already checked out of instead of moving us into the room they had promised us. Very poorly managed.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a dump, but definitely dated.”
Reviews.Author: rlslaw
Reviews.Content: Pro's: As advertised, it's really right on the beach. No streets to cross, no long walk; it's there! Similarly, the hotel parking was quite convenient. (Do NOT, however, park in a space either directly under or one space away from a lamp standard. (If you do, well there's a handy car wash about 6 blocks away!)) Overall hotel location = great. Quite decent wireless internet connection (and our room was at the end of the hallway). Super friendly and helpful desk clerk personnel. Nice size rooms--though it was hard to give a square footage guesstamate because it was so irregularly shaped. There's a nice workout area, though it's located in the neighboring, more upscale, sister hotel. Con's: Slow, cranky, kind of small elevators. The property desperately needed updating. The furnishing, rugs, linens, etc. Room suffered from an extreme shortage of wall outlets. There was a decent computer desk with built-in 3-prong outlets; but when I looked under it to try and figure out why none worked, I found the master switch wire had been snipped. Also, one could either plug in the microwave OR the office size refrigerator. After a call to the front desk, "engineering" responded quickly with a power strip to fix this, so I suppose the previous occupant went home with a power strip in their luggage. The coffee maker didn't work. Another front desk call, and another quick response by engineering with a brand new one. Only the very basic toiletries were provided. We were on a no-smoking floor, but the hallway nevertheless had a definite cigarette odor. There was a $1.50/day assessed charge for use of the room safe, but at checkout when we said we didn't use it, the charge quickly came off with no raised eyebrows, no questions, no requirement of a notarized statement, etc. Our 4-night stay here was pursuant to a Groupon coupon. The "deal" included free parking (otherwise $5/night), and $15/day credit at the lobby Atlantic Jack's restaurant. Even without the fairly useless restaurant credit (see my separate review there!), it was a good deal, and I'd stay there again without hesitation under the same terms.

Reviews.Title: “cheap”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The people that work there were very helpful in everything I needed or asked about. Always pleasant when we spoke to them and went out of their way to help us out. Very much appreciated! search for discounts

Reviews.Title: “Outdated- not recommended”
Reviews.Author: AllThePlacesWeGo
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the worst places ever. Our room was ok in size, but was VERY outdated. The bathroom was small, the door wouldn’t close properly, the sink faucet couldn’t be turned on without getting water all over the place. The bathroom was so dark that you have to shower with the curtain open in order to see. There was dust falling out of the bathroom vent, which indicated how often it is cleaned. I couldn’t even use the balcony because it was shared with the pigeons and their mess. I was on a nonsmoking floor, but everything definitely reeked of smoke. The customer service was less than optimal, I would not recommend this place to anyone unless this hotel does some major changes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: Laurieliz409
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay was exceptional due to the warm and wonderful staff! The ocean view (not ocean front) was excellent. Even the college kids from Canada were super. We got a Groupon special and couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Front Chic???...”
Reviews.Author: Ry83
Reviews.Content: Let me first start my review by saying this is a Daytona Beach hotel. The majority of business/tourism for the city is either drunk Spring Break students or drunk NASCAR fans. So the bar isnt really high in quality furnishings and upkeep of rooms. Every time I'm in Daytona it's for work and I'm always booked at a beach front hotel. They all seem to be pretty on par with each other as far as their accomodations and "amenities" go. Which are pretty gross in general. I stayed the night here on Fenruary 22nd 2012 kinda of gearing up for Spring Break and an event at the raceway. Our group was checked in by one person and our keys were distributed to everyone. Right off the bat... NONE of the keys worked. Not one key for 29 rooms. One person in our group tried their key a few times in his assigned room door and a woman from inside "his room" yells, "You obviously have the wrong room a**hole!" Another member of our group had to be let into "her room" by a staff member from the front desk. Problem was there was already another gentleman in the room... Naked. The front desk apologized for the rooms that were occupied and actually told us that they were unable to know which rooms were already assigned to other guests. (REALLY!) So multiple people and multiple trips up and down the slowwwwww elevators later keys were working and people were in rooms. Employees were in the hallways but were not very friendly or helpful and actually yelled at us for having our luggage in the hall. This was while we were waiting for new keys. Later that night after returning from work I came off the elevator onto my floor and was immediately hit with the smell of marajuana. When I got into my room it smelled as if someone had been smoking it IN my room. It was unbearable. I opened my balcony door (which faced the beach and was beautiful!) to air out and to left. When I came back a couple hours later the smell had weakened but was still there. I called the front desk who said they were sending security up since it was a non smoking floor but it continued multiple though out the night and made for a restless sleep. The wrap it up and review... The hotel is like most of the other hotels along the beach. Mediocre rooms. Sure there is a bed and toilet and shower. But, for example, the door kicks were rusted and the balcony had bugs. So don't expect luxury. It's right on the beach and close to lots of bars and restuaunts which makes it a great location. Where this hotel falls flat is in their seemingly incompetent staff and poor poor customer service. If that's not important then you should be fine here. Just don't expect any help or solutions should you run into any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Linny_10
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in a brochure from the Florida Welcome center. It was right on the beach for $45 city view, $55 beach view. Great, friendly staff both check-in & check-out. Clean rooms with great beds. We got the ocean view with an ajoining room with our traveling friends. The breakfast buffet included was a full meal with eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, fruit, pastries & cereal. Very tasty & filling. Only drawback was the $5 parking fee, but most of the hotels charge for parking. After breakfast, we had time to take a leisurely walk on the beach before the 11 am checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe great for young adults, not seniors”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: Nothing is included except the room. All phone calls charged; parking charge of $5 a night. No free newspapers, actually no newspapers on the premise. We were on the 11th floor and shared our balcony with the pigeons. Intimidating around the pool with young adults party time . Daytona 500 on this week-end and we are out of here

Reviews.Title: “In severe need of updating”
Reviews.Author: wiserperson36
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The room needs to be updated. The carpet was filthy because my socks were black ftom walking on it. I would pay more for an updated and cleaner room. Ashley at the front desk was excellent anf went beyond customer service. I won't return until the place has been remodeled. I will gladly pay more fot a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMe63
Reviews.Content: Very central location and friendly staff. Our room was large but the bathroom sink was cracked and there was paint peeling off the wall. It appeared clean but we had to move the couch and found several items (not ours) under there and it obviously hadn’t been moved in a while. The corridor had a strange smell Check in local tourist shops or Dennys for a RoomSaver book as they often have coupons for POC which could reduce the cost of your stay considerably. Beware of added extras - $5 parking per day, $1.50 for having a safe in your room, $10 for ocean view

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel 2 days before official Business Trip to Hilton / Waldorf Astoria in Orlando, FL. This hotel have great location!!! You just walk in directly into beach. Clean rooms, great breakfast. It was time to relax, and that's what we did!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay/Nice staff/Nice price!”
Reviews.Author: Keith Y
Reviews.Content: I recently spent five nights at this property. My room was comfortable, allowing me a good rest and the staff was pleasant. If noise bothers you at night, request an ocean view room, which is away from the street. The ice machines are on odd number floors, while vending machines are on even number floors. The staff is very friendly, especially Marie who served us during breakfast. A good value, good location, and good stay!

Reviews.Title: “not what it appears to be”
Reviews.Author: jon d
Reviews.Content: this hotel is tired the patios are dirty the paint is falling off but the view is to die for. the hotel lobby like the rest of the place is dull. the bar hahahah at least they have a bar. here is what i will say if you have a discount the beds are not bad the sofa and chairs kill. the kitchen pretends . the bath needs a bath!! staff is nice! oh well not for me at any rate! people were paying 119 to 169 in feb i got a coupon from the travel book at the rest area and paid 99 for ocean front with free hot breakfast> may i recomend the holiday inn same price no coupon and a 9 out of 10 have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little run down.”
Reviews.Author: Sharon B
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on the room so I don't want to complain too much but this hotel could definitely use some upgrading. The bathroom was tiny and very dated. The shower was old and dirty with painted tiles that were peeling. The faucets leaked continually and left rust stains on the tub. The microwave was filthy. It is in a good location though and walking distance to the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs to CLEAN IT UP!!!”
Reviews.Author: sparkyjane
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to be remodeled and cleaned up. We always go by trip advisor for recommendations for hotels when we travel. We were very disappointed after we checked in to this hotel. The reviews seemed pretty good but I don't know what they were thinking. My desk chair had blood stains on it and the bed skirt was all ripped. The whole place needs to be painted and remodeled. I would not stay here again and would not tell anyone else to.

Reviews.Title: “Average Ocean Front Hotel....Check in Nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveltilwerebroke
